summary: Pretense: by @starksparker Summary: When an intern for the Daily Bulge is set out to find the person behind the mask of New...
body:
Pretense: by @starksparker

Summary: When an intern for the Daily Bulge is set out to find the person behind the mask of New York’s Spider-Man, her life turns upside down with secrets, supervillains, and a boy by the name of Peter Parker.

summary: Pop Quiz: Lena Luthor or Peter Parker?
body:
Pop Quiz: Lena Luthor or Peter Parker?

“When bad things happen, and you have the power to stop it and you dont, then the bad things happen because of you.”

-will not share my f/o’s especially not peter

title: When I’m Not Feeling Beautiful
body:
I was feeling like crap about myself today and it helped to write this. :) Sometimes I get insecure that Peter wouldn’t like me, but then I realize I do have value, I matter, I deserve to be loved just like everyone else. <3




Her thoughts bounced and lingered, of appearances and flat stomachs and scales and social media.

Makena felt heavy. Even heavier than the number that disgusted her everytime she stepped upon the scale. Small tears escaping her eyes soon became sobs as she pondered deeper into the darkness of it all, and wondered why. Why she was born. Why she was given this body if she hated it so much.

A window opening was heard, but she didn’t even turn around, too lost in herself.

‘’Is-is that you?’’

She didn’t flinch at his question.

‘’Babe?’’ His warm arms wrapped around her thick waist and held her tightly, snapping her out of it.

‘’Hey.’’ She looked at her boyfriend, putting on a fake smile for him. ‘’How was patrol?’’

‘’Eh, the usual. Got another churro from that nice old lady again,’’ He chuckled softly. ‘’But how was your day?’’

The question almost felt like too much for her to answer. If she could, she’d put it all into words, the desperate desire to look like someone else, the awful feeling of being uncomfortable in your own skin. Her throat became dry as she tried to let the usual ‘’good’’ answer out. Before she knew it, uncontrollable hot tears flooded from her eyes.

He pulled her into a hug as she cried into his chest and stroked her hair softly, reassuring her.

‘’How about we go onto the fire escape and talk, ok?’’ He asked her ever so gently, his hands caressing her face. She could only nod as they walked outside and sat on the rail as he held her close, a breeze lingering as the sun set across the New York landscape.

For a moment, it was comforting silence, as she slowly stopped her crying and steadied her breathing.

‘’It’s stupid, really.’’ Makena chuckled to herself.

‘’Hey,’’ He grabbed both her hands, his soft brown eyes burning into hers. ‘’Nothing you feel is stupid. Your feelings are valid. And I am going to try and help you with whatever is going on, I promise.’’

The way he was so sweet to her made her want to cry once again.

‘’I just….’’ She sighed, trying to find the words. ‘’I wish I looked different. Like the other girls. I’m so different from everyone, sometimes I wish I wasn’t me.’’ Her voice shook as she finished the sentence, wondering how he’d react.

‘’Makena… That’s not true at all! I know I like you, even if you think you’re different.’’ His hand held hers.

‘’I can’t help but wonder why you do, though. You could have practically any girl- one of the sporty skinner smarter ones-I’-’’

‘’Hey, shhh.’’ He pulled her in for another tight embrace and kissed her forehead.

He pulled away and stared at her with those brown eyes again.

‘’You’re the one I want, Makena, You. No one else.’’ He grinned, before pointing at the sky.

‘’See the sunset? You’re beautiful, just like it!’’ She blushed as he carried on with his passionate rant

‘’And-and remember in class that one time when Mr Harrington told us about how when crystals have imperfections, it makes them interesting!’’ Peter continued.

Makena could only smile bashfully, her heart on fire at his words. If he believed she was beautiful, maybe she could believe it, too.

‘’I don’t want you to not feel beautiful, ever,’’ He caressed her cheek, his eyes desperate. ‘’You’re all these amazing things- you’re smart, you’re an amazing artist, you’re witty, you see life from this different perspective, and you’re a great girlfriend.’’ Peter smiled, kissing her forehead.

Makena smiled and held onto him tighter, her once bad feelings about herself healed and now good.

‘’You’re beautiful, don’t forget it, please.’’ The way he said ‘’please’’ made her soft inside.

Their lips connected as they kissed passionately, the stars coming out as night dawned upon them.

reblog.comment:
I was feeling like crap about myself today and it helped to write this. :) Sometimes I get insecure that Peter wouldn’t like me, but then I realize I do have value, I matter, I deserve to be loved just like everyone else. <3

Makena smiled and held onto him tighter, her once bad feelings about herself healed and now good.

Their lips connected as they kissed passionately, the stars coming out as night dawned upon them.

body:
So I bought an Art Deco captain America print for my game room in the new flat I’m moving into this Thursday and I’m real frickin excited.

Also found out there are iron man, spider man and hulk ones. Like. Yes. ✨✨✨
